title: Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description:
Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)

Under certain circumstances, the code assist in the UI consumes excess code. The enclosed class is an example. To make the program correct, a parameter must be added to the 'baz' function call in the 'bar' function.

Steps:
1. The UI can choose to use the code assist end position (until the end of the current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, in order to control the amount of source code to replace. The code assist option has been removed.
EB:
The code should be changed to:

baz(x.x.foo())
SR:
To reproduce the issue:

1. Change the 'baz' call to:

   baz(x.x.foo())

2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.'

3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist.

4. Type 'f' to filter the list.

5. Select 'foo()'.

6. Observe the behavior of the code assist.
